title.narrative: KNOWLEDGE ON NEONATAL AND MATERNAL CARE

description.narrative: At least 80% of mothers Including pregnant women in selected communities in targeted localities have comprehensive knowledge and capacity to seek appropriate neonatal, child, and maternal health care, including HIV/AIDS (including nationwide interventions)., which contributes to Maternal And Newborn Health. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Children, especially adolescents (both boys and girls), families and communities in the most deprived localities are resilient and adopt appropriate practices to reduce their vulnerability.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: At least 80% of mothers Including pregnant women in selected communities in targeted localities have comprehensive knowledge andcapacity to seek appropriate neonatal, child, and maternal health care, including HIV/AIDS (including nationwide interventions).

description.narrative: At least 85% of mothers including pregnant women acquired comprehensive knowledge on key family practices and appropriate care seeking behaviors especially in the hard to reach areas of Jebel Mara, White Nile and Darfur states. | Status:Met | As-of Date:16/01/2018
